You are a helpful assistant.
user
You are an AI agent performing tasks in Minecraft based on given instructions, history, and visual observations (screenshots). Your goal is to take the next optimal action to complete the task.
## Action Space
Your action space is hierarchical, including grounding-level and raw-action. You need to output a hierarchical action chain until the final raw-action is output. The action spaces at each level are as follows:
### skill actions
These are high-level skills that guide the agent toward completing complex tasks through multiple intermediate steps.
### grounding actions
* Kill mob(x,y) # Kill the Minecraft mobs. Note: The target of Action Kill needs to appear in the current observation image. 
* Mine block(x,y) # Destroy the Minecraft blocks. Note: The target of Action Mine needs to appear in the current observation image.
* Approach object(x,y) # approach to the target object.
* right click (x,y) # use the right lick button to interact with the object.
* move to (x,y) # Move the cursor in the GUI to the location of the object.
* no-op # wait and do not interact with the world
If multiple actions are activated, use ` and ` connect. 
### raw actions
* camera move y,x # Move the camera or the cursor in GUI. 
* hotbar i #  Switch to hotbar item at index i.
* forward  # Move forward.
* back # Move backward.
* right  # Strafe right.
* left # Strafe left.
* sprint  # Sprint in the current direction.
* sneak  # Sneak; modifies movement in GUI and world.
* use  # Use or place held item; in GUI, pick up/place one item.
* drop  # Drop one item; Ctrl-drop to release full stack.
* attack  #  Attack; in GUI, pick/place stacks or collect all similar items on double-click.
* jump  # Jump
* inventory  # Toggle inventory GUI.
If multiple actions are activated, connect without space.
## Continuously take action until the task is completed. 
Wrap your hierarchical action inside <skill>skill actions</skill>, <grounding>grounding actions</grounding>, raw actions
craft the item: green_bed

assistant
output:
My task is to craft the item: green_bed. The target item is not on this page. I need to transfer to the next page. The Skill ACTION is <skill>Transfer to the next page</skill>. The cursor is located atcursor(408,666)
. The object: next page button is located atnext page button(406,691)
. The cursor is on the object: next page button. The Grounding action is <grounding> left_click (407,686)
</grounding>. The Raw ACTION is <raw></raw>.

You are a helpful assistant.
user
You are an AI agent performing tasks in Minecraft based on given instructions, history, and visual observations (screenshots). Your goal is to take the next optimal action to complete the task.
## Action Space
Your action space is hierarchical, including grounding-level and raw-action. You need to output a hierarchical action chain until the final raw-action is output. The action spaces at each level are as follows:
### skill actions
These are high-level skills that guide the agent toward completing complex tasks through multiple intermediate steps.
### grounding actions
* Kill mob(x,y) # Kill the Minecraft mobs. Note: The target of Action Kill needs to appear in the current observation image. 
* Mine block(x,y) # Destroy the Minecraft blocks. Note: The target of Action Mine needs to appear in the current observation image.
* Approach object(x,y) # approach to the target object.
* right click (x,y) # use the right lick button to interact with the object.
* move to (x,y) # Move the cursor in the GUI to the location of the object.
* no-op # wait and do not interact with the world
If multiple actions are activated, use ` and ` connect. 
### raw actions
* camera move y,x # Move the camera or the cursor in GUI. 
* hotbar i #  Switch to hotbar item at index i.
* forward  # Move forward.
* back # Move backward.
* right  # Strafe right.
* left # Strafe left.
* sprint  # Sprint in the current direction.
* sneak  # Sneak; modifies movement in GUI and world.
* use  # Use or place held item; in GUI, pick up/place one item.
* drop  # Drop one item; Ctrl-drop to release full stack.
* attack  #  Attack; in GUI, pick/place stacks or collect all similar items on double-click.
* jump  # Jump
* inventory  # Toggle inventory GUI.
If multiple actions are activated, connect without space.
## Continuously take action until the task is completed. 
Wrap your hierarchical action inside <skill>skill actions</skill>, <grounding>grounding actions</grounding>, raw actions
Open the crafting table to make paper.

assistant
output:
My task is to craft the item: paper. The 'show all' is deactivated. I need to choose the item in the recipe book. The Skill ACTION is <skill>Choose the item paper in recipe book</skill>. The cursor is located atcursor(402,648)
. The object:  paper  is located at paper (280,531)
. The cursor is not on the object:  paper . The Grounding action is <grounding> move_to (281,529)
</grounding>. The Raw ACTION is <raw></raw>.

You are a helpful assistant.
user
You are an AI agent performing tasks in Minecraft based on given instructions, history, and visual observations (screenshots). Your goal is to take the next optimal action to complete the task.
## Action Space
Your action space is hierarchical, including grounding-level and raw-action. You need to output a hierarchical action chain until the final raw-action is output. The action spaces at each level are as follows:
### skill actions
These are high-level skills that guide the agent toward completing complex tasks through multiple intermediate steps.
### grounding actions
* Kill mob(x,y) # Kill the Minecraft mobs. Note: The target of Action Kill needs to appear in the current observation image. 
* Mine block(x,y) # Destroy the Minecraft blocks. Note: The target of Action Mine needs to appear in the current observation image.
* Approach object(x,y) # approach to the target object.
* right click (x,y) # use the right lick button to interact with the object.
* move to (x,y) # Move the cursor in the GUI to the location of the object.
* no-op # wait and do not interact with the world
If multiple actions are activated, use ` and ` connect. 
### raw actions
* camera move y,x # Move the camera or the cursor in GUI. 
* hotbar i #  Switch to hotbar item at index i.
* forward  # Move forward.
* back # Move backward.
* right  # Strafe right.
* left # Strafe left.
* sprint  # Sprint in the current direction.
* sneak  # Sneak; modifies movement in GUI and world.
* use  # Use or place held item; in GUI, pick up/place one item.
* drop  # Drop one item; Ctrl-drop to release full stack.
* attack  #  Attack; in GUI, pick/place stacks or collect all similar items on double-click.
* jump  # Jump
* inventory  # Toggle inventory GUI.
If multiple actions are activated, connect without space.
## Continuously take action until the task is completed. 
Wrap your hierarchical action inside <skill>skill actions</skill>, <grounding>grounding actions</grounding>, raw actions
craft the item: blue_ice

assistant
output:
My task is to craft the item: blue_ice. I need to open the recipe book first. The Skill ACTION is <skill>Open the recipe book</skill>. The cursor is located atcursor(447,446)
. The object: recipe book is located atrecipe book(378,390)
. The cursor is not on the object: recipe book. The Grounding action is <grounding> move_to (380,392)
</grounding>. The Raw ACTION is <raw></raw>.

You are a helpful assistant.
user
You are an AI agent performing tasks in Minecraft based on given instructions, history, and visual observations (screenshots). Your goal is to take the next optimal action to complete the task.
## Action Space
Your action space is hierarchical, including grounding-level and raw-action. You need to output a hierarchical action chain until the final raw-action is output. The action spaces at each level are as follows:
### skill actions
These are high-level skills that guide the agent toward completing complex tasks through multiple intermediate steps.
### grounding actions
* Kill mob(x,y) # Kill the Minecraft mobs. Note: The target of Action Kill needs to appear in the current observation image. 
* Mine block(x,y) # Destroy the Minecraft blocks. Note: The target of Action Mine needs to appear in the current observation image.
* Approach object(x,y) # approach to the target object.
* right click (x,y) # use the right lick button to interact with the object.
* move to (x,y) # Move the cursor in the GUI to the location of the object.
* no-op # wait and do not interact with the world
If multiple actions are activated, use ` and ` connect. 
### raw actions
* camera move y,x # Move the camera or the cursor in GUI. 
* hotbar i #  Switch to hotbar item at index i.
* forward  # Move forward.
* back # Move backward.
* right  # Strafe right.
* left # Strafe left.
* sprint  # Sprint in the current direction.
* sneak  # Sneak; modifies movement in GUI and world.
* use  # Use or place held item; in GUI, pick up/place one item.
* drop  # Drop one item; Ctrl-drop to release full stack.
* attack  #  Attack; in GUI, pick/place stacks or collect all similar items on double-click.
* jump  # Jump
* inventory  # Toggle inventory GUI.
If multiple actions are activated, connect without space.
## Continuously take action until the task is completed. 
Wrap your hierarchical action inside <skill>skill actions</skill>, <grounding>grounding actions</grounding>, raw actions
Create a gold ingot in the furnace.

assistant
output:
My task is to craft the item: gold_ingot. The goal item in recipe is chosen. I need to click the item in the crafting slot. The Skill ACTION is <skill>Click the item gold_ingot in the crafting slot</skill>. The cursor is located atcursor(569,383)
. The object: crafting slot is located atcrafting slot(746,373)
. The cursor is not on the object: crafting slot. The Grounding action is <grounding> move_to (747,377)
</grounding>. The Raw ACTION is <raw></raw>.
